comment: Damn it, I was rolling this idea in my head recently of remaking the old 500 body in plastic instead of metal, making a lightweight chassis and using a small electric motor as a urban runabout like the AMI. These vehicles are not considered cars, but heavy quadricycles here in Europe, so they don't have to meet the strict safety standards that regular cars have to follow. So my idea wouldn't be economically unfeasible and would probably be quite successful for FIAT if they had done it themselves. Close enough though.

comment: For â‚¬7500 >>after<< gov. subsidies AND >>before<< options the Topolino is an ultraimpractical toy for those rich people who can be fooled by marketing that this thing can make them appear commoners and down to Earth. You basically cannot carry any luggage because it will be stolen 5 minutes after you get away from the car and it will block your rear visibility all along the way. Hard ugly plastic is abundantly used in the interior as plainly visible in all clips. Underpowered. Charges like a snail. AC will be a joke as will ride quality and general quality. This car is a perversion of the very idea of making a small, practical, dependable, affordable car for the people.

video_title: Quick Video Review: 2022 Fiat 500 Dolcevita
comment:
Picked up my new UK 500c Dolcevita six speed manual today. Its 70BHP is perfectly useable on the motorway where the speed limit is actually 70mph not the 90 a lot of performance car drivers seem to think it is. I had no issue merging into fast flowing motorways on my trip home from the dealership. I set the cruise to 65 and it was doing 2700rmp in 6th gear with power to spare to get into the 2nd lane for passing.

In an era when all cars look the same, the 500 oozes style while it get's the job of going from A to B done.

The roads are not a race track but the 500 is like a red rag to the c**ts behind the wheels of BMWs and Mercs etc. and they just HAVE to show dominance by overtaking them. It's funny, though, every time I rounded a 3rd gear 30mph corner (without braking) with one of the afore mentioned ****s up my arse they were loads of car lengths back on exit. Of course they would all catch me on the straight because, without exception, they were all awesome in a straight line!

Oh yeah and the 1.0L Firefly engine has a sweet exhaust note. Well, it would, wouldn't it, it's Italian after all.

Un mezzo semovente che purtroppo non fa onore al nome glorioso di unâ€™ auto â€“ una VERA automobile, piccola, semplice, ma seria e completa - con la quale potevi non solo muoverti ma anche viaggiare, ovunque.
Un â€œaggeggioâ€ in plastica, dal baricentro molto alto, forse troppo, con un ventilatorino (ma neanche un vecchio taxÃ¬ in centro Africa ?! ) e un cuscinotto davanti (fa â€œvintageâ€â€¦.) che forse potrebbe ripararci i denti se qualche SUV o anche solo una vettura normale ci toccasse. Il portabagagli (sembra quello dellâ€™auto di Paperino) senza le cinghie (si pagheranno a parte?), o forse si spera che i bagagli vengano legati con una corda, come le valigie dei nostri nonni, farebbe ancora piÃ¹ â€œvintageâ€.
Questa specie di â€œcosoâ€ - non riesco a definirlo â€“ costa (!?!) 9890 â‚¬ (ovvero 7499 â‚¬ se si ha diritto agli incentivi, bontÃ  loro) quanto una volta 19.149.710 vecchie lire, quelle lire cambiate oggi con le quali perÃ² continuano a pagarci le pensioni e gli stipendi, cosa che si dimenticano in molti.
Purtroppo mi aspetto che questo commento NON verrÃ  pubblicato, ma non toglie che esprima la mia idea.
Un vero obbrobrio, un trabiccolo frutto di una scopiazzatura malriuscita di altre vetturette che oggi fanno tanto â€˜chicâ€™.
Boh, veramente ridicola.

comment:
non so quante volte ai pronunciato , che topolino non centra niente con la 500.
parlare di auto non farebbe male averne un po' di cultura.
la fiat topolino per chi se la ricorda, fu prodotta dagli anni trenta per desiderio del duce, che voleva stare a passo della Germania che con la produzione della Volkswagen doveva motorizzare il popolo tedesco, lo stesso duce impose anche il prezzo di vendita affinchÃ© si potessero auto munire quanti piÃ¹ italiani possibili.
vado a braccio circa 1.000/1.500 lire dell'epoca, alla fine sudando le fatidiche sette camice, i tecnici fiat tirarono fuori quella macchinina da bambini che noi conosciamo come topolino, con un prezzo finale non meno di tremila lire (vado sempre a memoria ) questo e il motivo delle dimensioni di quel modello. anno semplicemente costruito un auto, ma per accontentare chi governava, e stato impiegato la meta del materiale.
la topolino si e sempre chiamata fiat 500 il nomignolo topolino gli e stato affibbiato, proprio pe le sue dimensioni non so da chi ma e rimasto ne gli anni come nome popolare per definire quel modello, infatti la 500 (per far capire ai giovani quella di arsenio lupen dei cartoni animati,) che sostitui la topolino si chiamava nuova 500.
quelle di oggi ne anno il nome ma non la cilindrata.

video_title: 2023 Fiat 500 Review FIRST IMPRESSIONS & POV Test Drive [Dolcevita Hybrid London - England]
comment: I drove one of these over the weekend and the hybrid claim is a joke. At no point does the engine shut and an electric motor take over. None. I am assuming that they justify "hybrid" by allowing electrics to feebly augment the engine. But it is feeble. The car also has this annoying regen icon that lights up everytime the car coasts. I haven't driven any 500 before but I suppose as a small city car it's okay and it looks stylish. Boot is surprisingly large. Backseats are kids only. My renter was red like the video and the shiny red dashboard was distracting thanks to reflections.

comment:
actually this week I got one as exchange for my Jeep, which had to stay at the garage for repair some days.
In these days I had to go 400 Km on the Autobahn.
This has been one of the most terrible cars experiences I ever had.
This car is ok for going 100 meters arround the house, and that's it.
Super economical???
7.8 liters, this is a permanent full throttle car and the e-drive is allways empty and inactive.
I already had many Fiat cars in the past and I always have been very satisfied.
I ask my self, why such cars are built.
Driving this car now for three days gives me the feeling as it had a 50ccm engine and minus 10 HP.
If the mass murderer comes to hell once, his punishment will be to drive this car for eternity

video_title: 2022 Fiat 500 hybrid review â€“ is there a good car behind that cute face?
comment: I have just one of these as a hire car in Spain for 10 days. I grew really like it. It performed brilliantly on tight, twisty single track mountain roads where narrowness is a boon for passing. It needed to be worked hard, but could carry more speed through the corners than most other cars on the road. It was less convincing on the motorway, where it struggled with hills was a bit bouncy at speed. The computer calculated range was all over the place going from 100km to 0km climbing 400m up a mountain, back up to 150km by the time I reached the nearest petrol station.

video_title: 2022 Fiat 500 hybrid review â€“ is there a good car behind that cute face?
comment:
Being a fiat employee I often watch videos on fiat products and here goes :-
Q Not much room in the back ?
A What did you expect it to have ?
Q Boots small
A It's a small car
Q It's not very fast
A It's a 1.0
Q It's a bit plasticy
A It's a cheap car
Ok I might be sounding a bit biased as a fiat employee but I myself ran a 1.2 500 for 2 1/2 years and in all honesty it wasn't a bad car for what it was
So would I buy 1 or recommend 1
Yes but here's the but !!!

1.2 ONLY !!!
Check for noises from the front suspension
Check the Speedo works ok
Blue and me go wrong often on early cars
Buy a warranty as big as you can budget certain repairs could be expensive
But on a whole 50mpg easy to park cheap to repair mostly ie tyres brakepads decent enough to drive and good residual values

video_title: 2022 Fiat 500 hybrid review â€“ is there a good car behind that cute face?
comment:
Two questions ,how tall are you and how tall are you ?
I had one on hire for two weeks and it was terrible on fuel doing motorway runs .It was really hard to engage 6th ,when I told the guy who hired me it he said that it is a common fault along with the clutch pedal getting stuck to the floor even on cars with less than 1000 miles on the clock ! A bubble burst as I was so looking forward to driving it ,I also found it making me lean towards the centre when driving any distance ,I suspect the pedals are offset compared with my normal car .
I also found the battery was fully charged all the time so when it gets "used" I have no idea .I drove around Cornwall for a week so I did low speeds for lots of the time and didn't notice the Hybrid bit kicking in at all .I managed to get about 250 miles from a tank which seemed disappointing .

video_title: 2022 Fiat 500 hybrid review â€“ is there a good car behind that cute face?
comment: The car handles exceptionally well, even at 140kmh, good suspension balanced weight ratio, good to go fast around corners. But generally it is AWEFUL. The acceleration is INEXISTENT. I think the 70hp is only with the electric support which is constantly empty unless you want to be an obstacle and start coasting 100km before a red light. Also, at 100 kmh you are at 2500 or more RPM. When trying to accelerate you are faced with the following dilemma: either no acceleration: or b: hit the rev limiter. This car is so annyoing! You have to keep it at 5-6krpm and shift through all the gears to have somewhat of an acceleration.

video_title: 2022 Fiat 500 hybrid review â€“ is there a good car behind that cute face?
comment: Driven a couple of 2022 models, horrible vague steering feels like I have huge play in the straight ahead position. Then it seems to stick with little self centering. I have driven 100s of cars but nothing as odd as this. Then the engine feels like it's 20 years old, which it probably is, gutless or what? They look cute, but they drive worse than any other modern car. A 2005 fiesta drives better in every way.

video_title: 2022 Fiat 500 hybrid review â€“ is there a good car behind that cute face?
comment: Quite fancy the Dolce vita Plus, because it's now one of a very limited range of 3 door cars. OK the Mini is still on sale, but the bumpers, front and back, just look hideous. The 500 may not be the biggest for rear legroom, but in the 6 years I've had my 3 door Swift, the back seats have been used twice. Seems that car companies expect drivers to want ever-bigger cars and down sizing isn't catered for. Personally, I really don't want an SUV or a crossover but some manufacturers just expect me to like it or lump it.

video_title: 2022 Fiat 500 hybrid review â€“ is there a good car behind that cute face?
comment: Thanks Tim! I've had a 500 hybrid for about 2 years now, and I'm very happy with it. As you say, it's not very punchy on the motorway but it's not what it's been designed to do in the first place (the Abarth would fix that). I'm 5'6 and the steering is on the left - meaning that my left foot can rest on the side unlike the right hand drive - worth pointing out. It's cheap to buy, cheap to run because to compensate for the "punch" it's not using up much petrol, it's very easy to park, it's fun to drive, and if I'd had a penny for every time someone told me how beautiful it is, I'd be a millionaire by now! I've had 2 minor incidents with it. The first one when a tree branch crashed on the bonnet as I was driving (I'd have preferred winning the lottery on the odds of that!!) and I've had to replace the part - my insurance covered it. 2nd incident more recently: a deer ran across the road as I was driving at 50 mph on a country road and I could not avoid it. I hit it. Damage? luckily no other car was around me, and I didn't brake hard or veered off the road - it stayed well put on the tarmac as I slowly stopped the car. The bumper took all the shock, and moved very slightly. The pieces of chrome smashed, but none of the lights were broken. The part that holds up the radiator broke too, but that was it. I didn't even claim it on insurance because it didn't cost much to fix. As for the deer, it escaped!! It carried on running and I never saw it again - so I guess it survived. This experience taught me that it's actually a very secure tough little car as well as being cute, cheap and fun.

comment:
Ciao a tutti. Sono in possesso di una 5oo ibrida Sport dal 16 Dicembre 2020. Premetto alcune considerazioni: prendo fiat 500 con la formula Sempre Nuova, quindi un noleggio a lungo termine. Questa Ã¨ la mia terza 500 in 4 anni. Sempre allestimento Sport e le prime due con motorizzazione 1200 69 cv. Quindi posso fare un paragone sui consumi e tutto il resto. Uso lâ€™auto principalmente per andare a lavoro effettuando due tragitti al giorno di 6 km quindi un totale giornaliero di 12 km utilizzando una seconda auto per spostamenti medio lunghi, viaggi, trasporti ed ingombri vari. Lâ€™ ho presa perchÃ© volevo provare questo nuovo motore a paritÃ  di allestimento con le vetture passate, mi costava 1000eurini in meno e doveva darmi circa 4 km in piÃ¹ con un litro. PerchÃ© no! mi sono detto, tanto devo cambiarlaâ€¦proviamo!!!Ebbene parliamo adesso della la 500 ibrida :
sto terminando il mio primo pieno, sono ad oggi a 360 km . I consumi sono identici al 1200. Certo sono ancora al primo pieno ma sono molto deluso. Il problema Ã¨ il sistema elettrico BSG (Belt integrated Starter Generator) da 12 volt applicato direttamente sul motore che consente di recuperare energia in fase di frenata e decelerazione e stivarla in una batteria al litio da 11 Ah: funziona quando vuole lui!!!! Mi spiego meglio:
esco al mattino alle 08:30 con meno 4 gradi e si avvia il tutto, quindi start & stop attivo, Il sistema permette di recuperare energia in frenata o decelerazione e il motore termico si spegne anche in marcia, al di sotto dei 30 km/h.
Esco dallâ€™ufficio alle 18 con 3 o 4 gradi di temperatura e non si attiva nulla, solo il motore termico. Faccio notare le temperature esterne perchÃ¨ pensavo fosse quello il motivo della mancanza di attivazione dello start & stop ma non influisce. Ho escluso cintura di sicurezza non agganciata e/o batteria scarica. A volte non si attiva. A volte spegnendo il motore al semaforo, togliendo la chiave dal quadro e ripartendo si attiva. A volte durante la marcia si disattiva ma mai fino adesso Ã¨ avvenuto il contrario, attivarsi dopo unâ€™ accensione senza start & stop.
Alcune note positive della vettura:
il cambio a sei marce Ã¨ veramente piacevole e si avverte subito quanto comunicato dalla casa costruttrice la quale dichiara nuovi cuscinetti e guarnizioni a basso attrito ed utilizzo di uno specifico lubrificante ad alta efficienza .Ho notato la tenuta di strada e la stabilitÃ  piÃ¹ precisa forse come dicono, per via del motore che Ã¨ stato abbassato di 45 millimetri con il baricentro piÃ¹ basso.

And funny thing is, when you walk to the Fiat 500 which is parked next to a Range Rover, then you realise, how small this car isğŸ˜ Love it!

video_title: 2021 Fiat 500 Hybrid Review - Motorflix Vlog
comment: I agree with everything you say.  I live on Isle of Lewis, currently driving around 50 miles each day to work.  No problem at all.  Been round large chunks of the Highlands in it on holiday,  no issues and great fun.  I can't prove it but having just swapped from a 2016 plate to a new 72 Hybrid one, the ride, handling and suspension feel much better.  I think they've tweaked the hybrid to make it more refined.   It's a fantastic car that puts a smile on my miserable face!!

video_title: 2021 Fiat 500 Hybrid Review - Motorflix Vlog
comment: I'm 60 now and currently driving a Ford KA 2015 which had the same platform as the Fiat 500. Whilst the KA has been discontinued the 500 powers on and I'm interested in buying one now. One thing to be noted. As an older gentleman I want a car that will tow a small Halfords trailer for garden waste to dump or my camping equipment. Whilst the Ford KA is not rated to tow the 500 Rock Star is and will tow up to 800kg (depending on engine). Happy days.

video_title: 2021 Fiat 500 Hybrid Review - Motorflix Vlog
comment: I drive this car. Bought it in September 2020, with extremely low expectations and there you go, I completely agree with all you say. It's not nippy, but it sounds nice, costs nothing, and it's genuinely fun to drive!

video_title: What's It Like Living With A Fiat 500?
comment: As someone who drove BMWâ€™s for fifteen years then a Mercedes for five and after that Alfa Romeo for ten I can tell you that Fiat in general is very underrated. I have had a fiat as a second car since 1987 and they have always performed well. No, as the new 500 is testement to they go the distance. Look how many are still around after 15 years. Fiat have sold ove 3,000,000 500â€™s and there is a reason for that. It fits its market perfectly, it has something that far East cars would die for and that is it equals more than the sume of its parts. A little like Alfa it has what the French call Je ne sais quoi, a certain something that is hard to put your finger on but it puts a smile on your face every time you drive it. That retroesque interior, small but comfy enough for two people. Its economical but the performance is adequate for what it is. I have bought one and I just look for an excuse to take it for a run. I could never say that about any of the BMW, yes the look good in the office car park or down the pub and yes most perform well but since the E30 model they have lost their way, anaomus Hyundai clones. If there is just two of you than the Fiat 500 is fun with a capital F, next best thing to an Alfa.

video_title: Fiat 500C Hybrid review (TEGEN ELKE PRIJS) | ANWB Autotest
comment: Heb nu ruim 1.5 jr de 500 twin turbo cult 80 pk ge chip tuned door Savali naar 105 pk ik haal er met overwegend binnenwegen en een verderlichte rechter voet 1 op 19,5 mee da's heul wat anders dan 1 op 13 bakstenen voet hebbende anwb testers!! En veel geluid maken, nee met 1900 tpm kruisend op 75 km/h is hij fluisterstil nog stiller dan de 1.2 V4 die ik daarvoor 4 jr en 68k reed. Wat de tester niet snapt en Jeffrey Clarkson dan weer 100%  is dat de motor een geweldige grom afgeeft als je 'm goed op z,n staart trapt en doorhaalt naar 7000 tpm. Heb je niet eens een sportuitlaat en andere fratsen bij nodig. In het kort gezegd: RIJPLEZIER. Wat wel waar is, wil je een 500 koop je 'm ook en icoon, zonder meer. Dit gaat dus zeker niet mijn laatste 500 zijn mensen, wat een lekkere compacte auto, heerlijke hoge zit dus goed zicht rondom, goedkoop in gebruik en onderhoud, tijdloos retro 50 design, veel luxe, cabrio enfin wat wil je nog meer voor dat geld. comment: Geen beste review. En niet alleen omdat die Twin Air veel meer pret levert dan deze variant die niet bedoeld lijkt om te consument een lol te doen, maar om op papier de emissiecijfers van de fabrikant aan EU-regeltjes te laten voldoen. Ook omdat een Twin Air niet hoeft te zuipen. Hij roept wel continu tegen je dat hij er zin in heeft, vooral ook omdat die wÃ©l al bij lage toeren bij de les is. Je hoeft die dus juist niÃ©t op toeren te jagen. En als dat dashboardkastje je nu pas opvalt (zit er al jaren in), het geluid niet leuk vindt of serieus probeert achterin deze auto te gaan zitten, dan snap je er niet veel van. Enfin de verkoopcijfers spreken boekdelen. Het verhaal had dus een veel minder sneue toon mogen hebben.

video_title: 2024 Fiat 500e 3+1 (118 hp) - FINALLY coming to the US!
comment:
The doors close with such a terrible sound that was inherent in a cheap Chinese car 10 years ago. Charging from a home outlet is normal, on par with competitors, but "fast" at 85 kW is a shame! It is not clear why it was necessary to make a second row of seats, it would have been better to make a practical trunk. And just like that, useful materials were thrown to the wind and the environment was polluted in vain during their production. The materials look very cheap, even in those areas of the interior where there should be soft plastic (hard plastic was installed), it feels like they saved on everything! Even there are no mirrors in the protective visors... I personally have the feeling that several different teams were involved in this car, some started and others finished. Everything about this car literally screams of contradictions... You don't want to experience such impressions when buying a new car. Especially something as cute as the Fiat 500.
The only thing I liked was the color of the car.

comment:
Best thing about these tiny EV's is they are cheap and great for city driving. Here in the Netherlands allot of fresh employees in cities choose these cars because they are cheap. Have some luxury to it and important of all don't take up space.
Sure you sacrifice some space but hey. If you're new to a job have to pay rent etc. and don't have to commute long distances a tiny EV or very economical petrol is the way to go.
Personally i chose a bigger car but i can respect the place these cars have in society.

video_title: 2024 Fiat 500e 3+1 (118 hp) - FINALLY coming to the US!
comment: Imagine this same size vehicle.  Take all the junk in the front and move it to the back.   Now have a more vertical window in front and move the seats forward.   How much more seating space would you have?   No it would not be a VW van as this is still much smaller, but far more useful.    Ah!, you say, aerodynamics would suffer!     True, but is the fiat meant for high speed long distance commutes?  Not in my opinion, it's a city car, at that speed you would see little difference in range.

video_title: 2024 Fiat 500e 3+1 (118 hp) - FINALLY coming to the US!
comment: We are among the very few who still treasure an original 500e from 2013 in the brightest red-orange with white trim. Almost 10 years later still brightens our hearts to see it every time we drive it; always a head-turner, exhilarating little ride, and super comfy to drive (in the front seats)â€¦ Our two kids quickly outgrow the back seats but then again, they are driving their own cars now... After almost 10 years, still maintains an average range of 100 miles year round (160 km. the range diminishes about 1/3 in winter mostly do to heating and slower chemical reactions... ) It's such a great little city car that could do almost everything you need a car to do in the city or on the highway between close cities, so long you can charge it in between running errands. We even have a hitch-mounted bike rack to add to its capabilities. Perhaps a fast charge mode battery or a range extender trailer could make it perfect and this car could go anywhere!

video_title: 2024 Fiat 500e 3+1 (118 hp) - FINALLY coming to the US!
comment:
I drive these 500eâ€™s a lot and for city use for two people, itâ€™s great.

A few dislikes: Some models require two presses at the start to actually start. Canâ€™t think of any good reason why.

The collision alarm is like having your mother-in-law on the backseat.

The wipers are annoying. Some models have auto but itâ€™s not intuitive.

The car horn is just as embarrassing as you would fear by looking at this pregnant backpack.

The back hatch slams like itâ€™s gonna bend something over time.

The latch on the seats to make access to the back seats tends to stick and require numerous attempts to actually open.

The back seat belts always get in the way when you raise them from the flat position.

Some models come without GPS so you need to use your phoneâ€™s navigation. Cheeky.

Some models come with standard USB, some with USB-C and some with both. Usually two in all but sometimes three. 1-2 in the center console which only charge and one under the display which is the only one that gives access to Apple Car Play. Bluetooth is only available on some models.

Some models play some weird music OUTSIDE about half a minute after you start the car.

No anti spin in the ones Iâ€™ve driven, and with 118 HP on the front wheelbarrow tires, you will easily do a burnout.

The headrest are not comfortable.

Good plastic quality? Youâ€™re either joking or got a special edition.

Inside door buttons - an unnecessary gadget just waiting to break and coat a fortune to have fixed. Keep it simple, Fiat.

The cruise control and speed limiter are not intuitive.

Temperature control, fan control and seat heating are all controlled in the big car display instead of simple buttons.

When you put down the backseat, there will be a LOT of wind noise from back there. You get used to it but it indicates a typical Italian lack of interest in details.

The backseat is a waste of money. It has room for two double amputees or a medium sized dog.

The hat shelf is so small, you would never guess what it was if you didnâ€™t see it in place.

video_title: 2024 Fiat 500e 3+1 (118 hp) - FINALLY coming to the US!
comment:
The idea looks solid on paper, but it still looks plasticy; like it was made by Tupperware.

The backseats are for people who are ONLY torso, no legs. Reminds me of the time I sat in the â€œbackseatâ€ of a Lexus SC430 convertible. Had to sit sideways and skooch down, like I was a dismembered head being held up by friction from the front seats. Not fun.

Here in Texas, that interior would squeak and rattle in no time. (Considering our 108Â°F / 42Â°C temps usually cause ALL interiors to warp right way)

I do like the driving position. Good visibility.

If they could make a deal with Apple, and release colors that match iPhones, that might sell a few more to the niche crowd.

Rose gold is sooo 2015, but it kinda grew on me by the end of the video.

Excellent video!!!

video_title: 2024 Fiat 500e 3+1 (118 hp) - FINALLY coming to the US!
comment:
Electric door handles.. about the worst idea ever.. they don't offer any benefits over conventional mechanical doors and well anyone old enough here to know the story of Johnny Carson and his Delorean? ..he got a flat battery and was trapped in his car until the police could get him out..
The immediate response to that is modern cars have a manual over ride for such a situation.... yeah, so why have an expensive to repair/replace electric option instead of mechanical when they still leave the manual system in a car.. just in a much more awkward position to use..
Anyways Fiat's are not known for their quality in Australia.. perhaps these EV's will be a step in the right direction, only time will tell.

I am a big fan of the suicide doors with out the B-pillar, found on Mazda RX's & Mini Clubmans to give a couple examples. That said I do hate how they often (but not always) cheap out and only place the door on one side..

If anyone has gotten this far - genuine question - What is the cost of replacing that battery pack and is the battery pack on a separate warranty to the car?

video_title: 2024 Fiat 500e 3+1 (118 hp) - FINALLY coming to the US!
comment:
I think it's honestly a decent car... but not for the price they're asking for.
When the hybrid version of the same car starts at 15.190euro and the electric version starts at 25.890euro what do you really get for paying over 10.000euro more?

Not to mention you'll need to pay for charging infrastructure at your house and if you don't have a garage or driveway you're kind of screwed which lets be honest most people wanting this car would likely live in the city where those are not that common or even an option to most and if you do have the option of having a garage and or driveway in the city you probably have the means to get a more luxurious car.

In the end EV's still come at a huge premium... most of which cost 10k more than their gas or hybrid counter parts and I really hope that they are going to be able to close that gap but they seem to be struggling a lot with that.
Even if a car is closing that gap it will end up with everything else about the car being lesser quality to their gas or hybrid counterparts or being less feature rich.

comment: Once tried a rental 2017.  Fiat 500, yes, it was fun to drive in the city, felt like go-cart, but that gearbox, doing 50 km/h you already in top gear, 70 on the ring road meant engine grinding over 3500 rpm, and almost unbearable in the saloon. Good that they put in 6 gear gearbox now, I hope that they increased gear ratio too.

video_title: Fiat 500C Hybrid - Mini Cabrio Instead of MX-5? (ENG) - Test Drive and Review
comment: We have had two 500 Lounge models .Keep them about four years and 40k miles then sell on. Low depreciation and servicing (non franchised garage) , fun to drive and economical. We get about 50mpg and drive briskly . Weak point is the sump . The cover rusts and , after three years will need renewing . Not an expensive job but Fiat really should use better quality steel. The rear  shock absorbers donâ€™t last long (we have rough roads round us) and I replace them with decent gas filled aftermarket ones. They really make the handling much much better , improve the ride and last ! We came from a Mini and wouldnâ€™t go back

video_title: Fiat 500C Hybrid - Mini Cabrio Instead of MX-5? (ENG) - Test Drive and Review
comment: Having a 595c, no complaints in the acceleration department, do not recognize the comment wrt open space in the chair either... what works for me; it is an ideal second car. Not only for the groceries, but an inexpensive cabrio as well... my previous second cars were dull as hell, this one is not... the 595c I prefer driving over my suv... especially on sunny days

comment:
We bought our son a Fiat 500 Lounge for his first car a year or so ago as our cars are automatic and he needed a manual to learn in.
After a few weeks we found that we were all driving the Fiat rather than our own cars - it was such fun to drive.
Yes, parts of the dash rattle a bit when the weather is cold and the seating position is a bit high but apart from that itâ€™s fab.
Would highly recommend and would buy another one.

video_title: Fiat 500C Hybrid - Mini Cabrio Instead of MX-5? (ENG) - Test Drive and Review
comment:
owned a 500 diesel, very pleasing to eye, enjoyed every moment with it, was very cheap to run, but the quality was terrible. the passenger airbag started to crack because it was swelling underneath the plastic! with a little research i found out that was a very common issue to countries with hot climates!
so Marek i guess in a small Mediterranean town you would have less problems with the mx5. i think the weather of Poland would be better for the quality issues of 500.

video_title: Fiat 500C Hybrid - Mini Cabrio Instead of MX-5? (ENG) - Test Drive and Review
comment:
had a 500c 80hp for 5 years as a company car
fast enough,reliable and fun to have
negative: ride comfort,steering vague,not as economical as advertised,vw up was 20% better
positive:depreciation just 1500 eur/year.
tried the new 500e,but the issues with the roof and handling have not been improved,and the price is crazy

video_title: Fiat 500C Hybrid - Mini Cabrio Instead of MX-5? (ENG) - Test Drive and Review
comment:
Fiat knows better. They know you shouldn't be going fast, slow down, see the world around you. It should only sound like you are going quick. It also says to the women, I don't take myself seriously, hop in, let's go to the beach and be "free" Mi piace molto!

This reminds me of a trip to France my wife and I took awhile back. Our B and B host owned a 2CV. I asked how she likes it. She said, we've owned it 20 yrs, the best feature is the narrowness because you are close to your mate. We leave the top open and if it rains, who cares? The seats are like lawn chairs and it has a drain!! LOL.

I think these cars should come with sunglasses and a flamboyant scarf. ;P. Thanks Marek Ciao!!

A week is so long, but now the time has come for some funny and interesting stuff! ğŸ˜€ğŸ˜€ğŸ˜€ I am driving my 500 Hybrid Sport GSE since 355 days to be exact and covered almost 27.000 km for trips to work and weekend fun. I am happy with the purchase and although I am 1,85m tall, I like to rise the seat in order to fill the gap between the seat cushion and the backrest. I fully agree that the car is on the slow side, but on the other hand it is really well built and keeps fighting the Croatian roads, which are not the best really.

comment:
On peut donc dire que PSA pouvait oser appeler ses anciens vÃ©hicules dotÃ©s des e-HDi 92 et 115 "Hybrid" entre 2011 et 2014.
Ca m'Ã©nerve de voir que les gens peuvent Ãªtre trompÃ©s par des discours marketing nuls.

Les dÃ©nominations officielles sont trompeuses maintenant depuis quelques temps. Comme Audi qui sort le SUV e-tron (100% Ã©lectrique) mais il existe une A3 e-tron (hybride rechargeable).
Pareil chez PSA avec les HYbrid et HYbrid4: les deux sont des hybrides rechargeables mais le nom ne l'indique pas. Situation identique chez DS avec le badge E-Tense qui propose du plug-in sur le DS 7 Crossback et du 100% Ã©lectrique sur le DS 3 Crossback.

Faut vraiment s'y connaitre maintenant, sauf faire confiance au maÃ®tre de l'hybride (ou full hybrid): Toyota.

video_title: Fiat 500C Hybrid review (TEGEN ELKE PRIJS) | ANWB Autotest
comment: Heb nu ruim 1.5 jr de 500 twin turbo cult 80 pk ge chip tuned door Savali naar 105 pk ik haal er met overwegend binnenwegen en een verderlichte rechter voet 1 op 19,5 mee da's heul wat anders dan 1 op 13 bakstenen voet hebbende anwb testers!! En veel geluid maken, nee met 1900 tpm kruisend op 75 km/h is hij fluisterstil nog stiller dan de 1.2 V4 die ik daarvoor 4 jr en 68k reed. Wat de tester niet snapt en Jeffrey Clarkson dan weer 100%  is dat de motor een geweldige grom afgeeft als je 'm goed op z,n staart trapt en doorhaalt naar 7000 tpm. Heb je niet eens een sportuitlaat en andere fratsen bij nodig. In het kort gezegd: RIJPLEZIER. Wat wel waar is, wil je een 500 koop je 'm ook en icoon, zonder meer. Dit gaat dus zeker niet mijn laatste 500 zijn mensen, wat een lekkere compacte auto, heerlijke hoge zit dus goed zicht rondom, goedkoop in gebruik en onderhoud, tijdloos retro 50 design, veel luxe, cabrio enfin wat wil je nog meer voor dat geld. Het is bijna als de panda reclame: je blijft lachen en lacht iedereen vet uit.

video_title: FIAT Panda/500 ibride: la nostra prova
comment:
Ciao a tutti. Sono in possesso di una 5oo ibrida Sport dal 16 Dicembre 2020. Premetto alcune considerazioni: prendo fiat 500 con la formula Sempre Nuova, quindi un noleggio a lungo termine. Questa Ã¨ la mia terza 500 in 4 anni. Sempre allestimento Sport e le prime due con motorizzazione 1200 69 cv. Quindi posso fare un paragone sui consumi e tutto il resto. Uso lâ€™auto principalmente per andare a lavoro effettuando due tragitti al giorno di 6 km quindi un totale giornaliero di 12 km utilizzando una seconda auto per spostamenti medio lunghi, viaggi, trasporti ed ingombri vari. Lâ€™ ho presa perchÃ© volevo provare questo nuovo motore a paritÃ  di allestimento con le vetture passate, mi costava 1000eurini in meno e doveva darmi circa 4 km in piÃ¹ con un litro. PerchÃ© no! mi sono detto, tanto devo cambiarlaâ€¦proviamo!!!Ebbene parliamo adesso della la 500 ibrida :
sto terminando il mio primo pieno, sono ad oggi a 360 km . I consumi sono identici al 1200. Certo sono ancora al primo pieno ma sono molto deluso. Il problema Ã¨ il sistema elettrico BSG (Belt integrated Starter Generator) da 12 volt applicato direttamente sul motore che consente di recuperare energia in fase di frenata e decelerazione e stivarla in una batteria al litio da 11 Ah: funziona quando vuole lui!!!! Mi spiego meglio:
esco al mattino alle 08:30 con meno 4 gradi e si avvia il tutto, quindi start & stop attivo, Il sistema permette di recuperare energia in frenata o decelerazione e il motore termico si spegne anche in marcia, al di sotto dei 30 km/h.
Esco dallâ€™ufficio alle 18 con 3 o 4 gradi di temperatura e non si attiva nulla, solo il motore termico. Faccio notare le temperature esterne perchÃ¨ pensavo fosse quello il motivo della mancanza di attivazione dello start & stop ma non influisce. Ho escluso cintura di sicurezza non agganciata e/o batteria scarica. A volte non si attiva. A volte spegnendo il motore al semaforo, togliendo la chiave dal quadro e ripartendo si attiva. A volte durante la marcia si disattiva ma mai fino adesso Ã¨ avvenuto il contrario, attivarsi dopo unâ€™ accensione senza start & stop.
Alcune note positive della vettura:
il cambio a sei marce Ã¨ veramente piacevole e si avverte subito quanto comunicato dalla casa costruttrice la quale dichiara nuovi cuscinetti e guarnizioni a basso attrito ed utilizzo di uno specifico lubrificante ad alta efficienza .Ho notato la tenuta di strada e la stabilitÃ  piÃ¹ precisa forse come dicono, per via del motore che Ã¨ stato abbassato di 45 millimetri con il baricentro piÃ¹ basso.
Ripeto, sono pochi km, pur essendo un mese di utilizzo, ma se devi fondare tutto lâ€™ibrido sul sistema elettrico BSG e questo si attiva quando vuole, sarai sempre e solo col motore termico alle partenze, senza start & stop e quindi i consumi e la questione ambiente va a farsi benedire. A me non cambia niente dal punto di vista pratico, questa 500 o la 1.2 , una vale lâ€™altra ma se devo consigliarla sulla base della mia esperienza attuale, ho seri dubbi sui consumi dichiarati che secondo la Casa, dovrebbe garantire consumi ed emissioni ridotti dal 20% al 30%......
Non penso di portarla in officina per un controllo, conoscendoli so giÃ  le risposteâ€¦.VedrÃ² nei prossimi mesi come si comporterÃ â€¦..

comment:
Ungaro sempre una garanzia, non aggiungo altro!

Ma tornando alle auto:
1: ottimo l'appunto che mild, full, plug-in e elettriche (con riserva) per la legge sono uguali, una ca*ata pazzesca, chi compra audi mild da 90k ha le stesse esenzioni di chi compra una panda da 15k, ottimo direi.
2: riguardo alla guida hai detto tutto, ho guidato sia 500 che Panda city cross (quindi "altina") fire e la differenza Ã¨ abissale, la panda Ã¨ una barca...
3: facilitÃ  di guida, qui non sono d'accordo, il cliente tipo di panda o 500 non metterÃ  mai, MAI in folle per risparmiare benzina, io lo farei, ma non comprerei mai panda o 500; mia nonna, che possiede la city cross, neanche sa cosa sia lo start and stop, fa 11-12km/l in media, non sa cosa sia la quinta marcia, ma nonostante tutto guida bene, non Ã¨ il tipo da sfrizionate eccetera.
4: i consumi che dichiarate li ho fatti io con la city cross fire in un viaggio lungo, guidando bene, e non ho tutta questa esperienza, sinceramente.
5: spazio? Nella panda? Io sono alto 1,93m (abbassando tutto il sedile ci sto a malapena), dietro di me qualcuno ci sta ma...anche no. Nella 500 ancora peggio ma del resto quello lo hai detto anche tu.
6: i 13 anni della 500 e gli 8 della panda, come modelli, oltre ad indicate discreti successi indicano anche la scarsitÃ  di voglia di innovare; personalmente la famiglia firefly la vedo come un "ah il fire non passerÃ  piÃ¹ i test di omologazione, facciamo qualcosa di nuovo, ma non troppo nuovo, deve sapere di vecchio". A mio parere Ã¨ cosÃ¬, ma come ho detto non ho questa grande esperienza e le mie critiche si fermano ai commenti di youtube. Con questo mild-hybrid mi viene da congiungere i punti: legge che considera tutti gli ibridi uguali+clientela che vuole cose "vecchie" nel senso buono+non voglia di fare una piccola rivoluzione+follia per l'ibrido degli ultimi tempi= Fiat ha trovato pane per i suoi denti, ma il fattore Italia ci ha messo del suo.

A mio avviso anche le full-hybrid sono superate, andavano bene 5 o 10 anni fa, al giorno d'oggi il plug-in dovrebbe essere il minimo, ecco perchÃ© vendere un misero mild (che mi sa proprio di truffa, a 12 volt poi...manco 48) come una rivoluzione mi fa male dentro, perchÃ© produrlo Ã¨ una scelta dettata da miseri interessi economici, che Ã¨ giusto ci siano, non Ã¨ una colpa, ma non dovrebbe essere cosÃ¬ e basta, per la situazione in cui siamo.

Poi FCA se ne esce con l'ottimo prodotto che Ã¨ la 500 elettrica, ditemi dove sta la coerenza? Un prodotto cosÃ¬ ben studiato affiancato da un....mild-hybrid?

comment: Once tried a rental 2017.  Fiat 500, yes, it was fun to drive in the city, felt like go-cart, but that gearbox, doing 50 km/h you already in top gear, 70 on the ring road meant engine grinding over 3500 rpm, and almost unbearable in the saloon. Good that they put in 6 gear gearbox now, I hope that they increased gear ratio too.

video_title: Fiat 500C Hybrid - Mini Cabrio Instead of MX-5? (ENG) - Test Drive and Review
comment: We have had two 500 Lounge models .Keep them about four years and 40k miles then sell on. Low depreciation and servicing (non franchised garage) , fun to drive and economical. We get about 50mpg and drive briskly . Weak point is the sump . The cover rusts and , after three years will need renewing . Not an expensive job but Fiat really should use better quality steel. The rear  shock absorbers donâ€™t last long (we have rough roads round us) and I replace them with decent gas filled aftermarket ones. They really make the handling much much better , improve the ride and last ! We came from a Mini and wouldnâ€™t go back

Fiat knows better. They know you shouldn't be going fast, slow down, see the world around you. It should only sound like you are going quick. It also says to the women, I don't take myself seriously, hop in, let's go to the beach and be "free" Mi piace molto!

This reminds me of a trip to France my wife and I took awhile back. Our B and B host owned a 2CV. I asked how she likes it. She said, we've owned it 20 yrs, the best feature is the narrowness because you are close to your mate. We leave the top open and if it rains, who cares? I think these cars should come with sunglasses and a flamboyant scarf. ;P. Thanks Marek Ciao!!

The Fiat range is quite old in Europe.
The latest model launched in Europe from Fiat is the 500e (not available in SA). The 500x and Tipo/Egea have been available since 2015, the Panda since 2012 and the ICE 500 since 2007.

In Brazil on the other hand, their lineup is newer.

Ich fahre den jetzt seit einem Jahr und bin immer noch begeistert - mit Abstrichen.
Wie im Bericht gesagt ist der 500e ein tolles Stadtauto und man schafft im reinen Stadtbetrieb im Sommer locker 270km (ohne Klima) und im Winter etwa 240km.
Sobald man Autobahn fÃ¤hrt wrd's eklig. Die Reichweite schrumpft auf 190km und real sollte man aufgrund der eher schlechten Ladeinfrastuktur besser schon nach 150km eine LadesÃ¤ule suchen. So braucht man dann fÃ¼r die 400km von Hamburg nach Wuppertal statt der Ã¼blichen gut 4 Stunden eher gut 6 Stunden. Das ist trotz der SchnelllademÃ¶glichkeit deutlich lÃ¤nger.
Und sonst so? Es gibt manchmal Elektronikprobleme. Alle paar Wochen stellt sich der TouchScreen und alle Anzeigen unmotiviert auf Werkseinstellung zurÃ¼ck und man wird dann auf italiensch begrÃ¼ÃŸt. Nicht dramatisch und eher ein sympathische Schrulle, manchmal lÃ¤stig.
Die Rekuperation bis zum Stillstand (One Pedal Drive) funktioniert im "Range" und "Sherpa" Modus ausgezeichnet, wobei ich das GefÃ¼hl habe, dass es nach einem Jahr etwas schlechter geworden ist.
Der Kofferraum ist fÃ¼r einen Zwei-Personen-Haushalt vÃ¶llig ausreichend. UmzÃ¼ge oder viel GepÃ¤ck wird man eher nicht damit bewÃ¤ltigen.
Hinten sitzen ist eine Qual.
Wirklich Ã¤rgelich ist, dass es keine MÃ¶glichkeit gibt das Ladekabel gut zu verstauen. So etwas muss bei einem E-Auto mit bedacht werden.
Auch die Navigation ist eher so mittel. Das Navi zeigt Ladepunkte auf der Strecke an, aber halbherzig und unvollstÃ¤ndig. Eine wirkliche RoutenfÃ¼hrung mit rechtzeitigen Stops gibt es nicht.

btw SchÃ¶ner Bericht

comment:
Ich freue mich so auf den 500e La Prima 3+1 den sich meine Mom und ich bestellt haben. Ist wohl Mitte Juni abholbereit. Er wird unser einziges Auto sein. Es ist so cool, dass es endlich ein kleines Auto mit geiler verbauten Technik, vernÃ¼nftigen Ladezeiten und ordentlicher Reichweite gibt. Wir sind total excited. Dieser SUV Wahn ist vollkommen unnÃ¶tig und das kommt von jemandem der vorher einen Jeep gefahren ist.

Zum Thema Gangwahl ist das Ganze sicher Geschmackssache, aber ich finde die KnÃ¶pfe im 500e genial. Was da an Platz eingespart wurde, welcher der Beinfreiheit zu Gute kommt ist mega. Wir saÃŸen im Autohaus in beiden Varianten (Elektro und Hybrid) Probe und haben im Hybrid Beklemmungen bekommen. Im Elektro haben wir uns sofort wohl gefÃ¼hlt.

Zum Thema Software stimme ich hier teilweise zu. Das es lange lÃ¤dt kann ich so gar nicht bestÃ¤tigen (auf Basis der sehr viel geschauten Videos und der Probefahrt, welche doch recht Ã¼ppig war). Im Gegenteil. Gerade im Navi lÃ¤dt er unheimlich schnell und auch zoomen in der Karte ist auf Tesla Niveau. Es soll aber noch ein paar Bugs geben (kenne ich auch von meinem UConnect des Jeeps). Die gehÃ¶ren sicherlich behoben. Die App gehÃ¶rt auch mal generalÃ¼berholt. Hatte aber die gleiche bei meinem Jeep und da hat das NÃ¶tigste auch funktioniert, von daher werde ich das noch sehen.

Den LautstÃ¤rkeregler hat meine Mom ohne Fragen und Probleme und ohne das Auto in irgendeiner Weise schon mal gesehen zu haben (Bilder, Videos, etc.) sofort selbst gefunden. Das ist hier schon ein bisschen Korinthenkackerei ^^.

10:05 Das RÃ¼ckbÃ¤nke nicht mit Stoff bezogen sind, habe ich aber auch schon in deutlich hÃ¶herpreisigen Autos gesehen.

Alles in allem ist der Fiat in seiner Klasse sicherlich ganz vorne dabei, wenn nicht sogar der Beste. Man darf nicht vergessen, dass man hier von einem KLEINSTwagen spricht. Der ist gar nicht gedacht fÃ¼r die mega Langstrecken und wird so auch nicht beworben. Trotzdem ist das Ganze aufgrund der ordentlichen Reichweite und Ladegeschwindigkeit durchaus mÃ¶glich. Wir zum Beispiel werden mit ihm ca. 600 km nach Holland fahren. Man muss vielleicht einmal mehr laden, aber ganz ehrlich, wen juckts im Urlaub? Ich kann hier die Videos vom Kanal Elektrobays empfehlen. Die haben den guten ordentlich auf Langstrecke getestet.
Ich finde leider, dass hier im Video irgendwelche Mangel regelrecht gesucht und herbeigezogen wurden (siehe LautstÃ¤rkeregler), was mich ziemlich stÃ¶rt und zum Daumen runter bringt. Ich habe das GefÃ¼hl, dass der 500e hier mit Autos der hÃ¶heren Klassen verglichen wurde, was nicht fair ist. Vergleicht man das Ganze mal zum Beispiel mit dem Honda E (viel schlechtere Reichweite) oder dem E-Up oder E-Twingo (beide auf Verbrennerbasis, der Fiat ist zu 96% neu und hat auch hier die bessere Reichweite, Software und Materialien), dann ist der Fiat der deutliche Gewinner. Mit den genannten Beispielen sollte man den Fiat vergleichen und nicht mit groÃŸen Autos (Stichwort Platz).
Und wenn wir schon bei Platz sind, dann nenne ich mal den Ur 500 aus den 50ern. Der war noch viel kleiner und es hat auch die Familie samt GepÃ¤ck rein gepasst. Komfortabel war vermutlich anders, aber es ging und die haben sich auch nicht beschwert.

Ich habe mir den Kleinen auch angeschaut als Zweitwagen und getestet, habe mich aber letztendlich fÃ¼r einen Corsa-e entschieden. Warum? Mein Fahrprofil entspricht nicht dem, wo sich der 500e zu Hause fÃ¼hlt. Ich habe relativ ausgeglichenes Stadt/Land/Autobahnprofil als Arbeitsweg, weswegen der Corsa mit realistischen knapp 100km Reichweite einfach mehr Sicherheit gibt (nur 1-2x die Woche Laden statt 2-3x beim Fiat). Dann hat der Corsa-e einen grÃ¶ÃŸeren Kofferraum, welchen ich auch oft nutze um meine Arbeitssachen zu verstauen (oder eben 2 Einkaufskisten). Und letztendlich der Preis: 31k fÃ¼r den Flitzer ist schon happig. Habe meinen Corsa (Elegance Variante) ordentlich mit ZusÃ¤tzen ausgestattet und bin bei knapp 33k (u.A. video_title: Fiat 500 Hybrid review: A stylish city car | TotallyEV
comment: We had 2x Fiat 500's as rental cars on Sardinia in 2022 + start of 2023 in Portugal. On Sardinia we had the regular non hybrid version and in Portugal the 500e. The last one not a real pleasant car to drive in my opinion. Maybe in cities itself or more flat countries als the Netherlands where I'm from but we didn't find it pleasant to drive. The clutch smells burned really really quick if you have some short stop/up-hill/stops etc. Also warning lights with the stop/start system. The regular petrol 500 drives more smooth. Rental car companies better invest in the new 500 full EV besides petrol 500's.

video_title: Fiat 500 Hybrid review: A stylish city car | TotallyEV
comment:
Agree. It's not an hybrid. It's just an enhanced Start&stop system. A very good one without any vibrations.
You can't feel any extra power coming from the battery and consumptions are very disappointing if you drive normally.
Regarding the comfort I don't find it bad. It's perfect for the city. That's sure that the for the same amount of money you can easily find a better car but you can't find a car with such a charm.

video_title: NEW 2021 Fiat 500 Dolcevita 1.0 Petrol-Hybrid
comment: I bought one last year in France, it's a gorgeous car (I got the dark blue version that has the same chrome finish throughout and ivory interior). It's a beautiful looking little car! I love it. A few tricks I found out gradually that's quite nifty: you can slide all the vent handles up and down - not just the usual swing with the vents but the handles all move up & down! it's really cool to clip a mobile phone holder for navigation & carplay connect. 2nd nifty trick good to know about: when one of the doors/boot isn't closed properly, when you press the key beep, the car flashes the signals in a way to make you aware of that anomaly. 3rd nifty trick, if you want to central lock all the doors when inside (ie. when driving through an unsafe area), it's possible by pressing down the door handle on the driver's side - it looks both doors at the same time this way. Another cool trick it has is that when you come home at night and there's no light to see the keyhole of the gates, you can stop the car and push down the lights knob a few times and it goes into "follow me home" mode. The more you press it down the longer the lights will stay on after the ignition's off, with max time of 210 seconds. It's all cool tricks to know about.

video_title: New Fiat 500 Hybrid 2021 Test Drive Review POV
comment:
actually this week I got one as exchange for my Jeep, which had to stay at the garage for repair some days.
In these days I had to go 400 Km on the Autobahn.
This has been one of the most terrible cars experiences I ever had.
This car is ok for going 100 meters arround the house, and that's it.
Super economical???
7.8 liters, this is a permanent full throttle car and the e-drive is allways empty and inactive.
I already had many Fiat cars in the past and I always have been very satisfied.
I ask my self, why such cars are built.
Driving this car now for three days gives me the feeling as it had a 50ccm engine and minus 10 HP.
If the mass murderer comes to hell once, his punishment will be to drive this car for eternity

video_title: New Fiat 500 Hybrid 2021 Test Drive Review POV
comment: 6th gear at 50 mph (80 kph). I've a U.S. FIAT, 5 spd., and I never let the RPM's go below 3000 unless the engine is really lightly loaded. The reason being for me is the engine simply doesn't like being at low revolutions. Not that I rev it either but I find my '12, 500 likes 3000 to 4000 rpm if some hill climbing is needed. 1368 cc, non-turbo. 101 hp. MultiAir. What's interesting as well is the old U.S. 500 models ('12-'19) were the most insulated of all the FIAT's worldwide, making them the quietest.

video_title: Agnelli: La Dolce Vita
comment:
From the greatest powerful men in the world '' Prince Gianni Agnelli '' has been for 50 years the true icon of the World Dolce Vita
Wherever he had a party, you could find all of the Italian monarchy with a French monarchy who have always married each other, the oldest monarchies in the world and the greatest men in the world, including the nobility of the Vatican city.
Even today his style is copied by the greatest men, the typical Italian man, crazy for cars and women, the two things he loved after his factories around the world
Now there is no longer a true Icon like that of the Lawyer Gianni Agnelli, an encyclopedia of real fun and true Italian style '' the sweet life '' Even Jackye Kennedy wanted Gianni Agnelli, but he after some night outings, told her to come back from poor copy photo of Giagni Agnelli '' Onassis ''
Onassis had a terror of the simplicity of Gianni Agnelli and his infinite taste of the art of knowing how to speak more than 6 languages â€‹â€‹correctly, which Onassis was a wealthy entrepreneur who grew up after the great war in gracia
Onassis knew that it was impossible to be an Italian with their crazy and sweet style

video_title: Agnelli: La Dolce Vita
comment: You need to know the following to understand Agnelli's connection with Pamela. Pamela Digby Churchill had started as Debutante of the Year because of her liveliness and free spirit. She was extremely well-connected to the UK and USA government through her love affair with Harriman, US war ambassador to the UK, and being the confidante of Winston Churchill Sr. during the war. She came out of the war with a child called Winston Churchill Jr.. When someone invited her and said "You may bring Winston," she would ask "Which one?" and Agnelli and others would love to say, "Oh well, bring them both." :-)  (Churchill had been jobless right after the war ended.)

comment:
I have owned my 2013 500 POP 5 speed. I have only replaced the battery and then the tires, because it gets violently hot. Had to fill the r134a refrigerant and it was 50% off so i paid $95.â°â° with a Shrader Valve. The air is COLD at 110â° outside. This car is so underrated, it's so much car, room, im 6 foot 2 inches and can sit straight up with 6 inches to spare.
The basebstreo is a great sounding streo and no annoying rear camera on 2013. This car had great technology. The multi-port technology cost Fiat $100 million and increased torque by 10% and gas mileage 10% this car is an incredible value, i love her!â¤

comment:
I have owned my 2013 500 POP 5 speed. I have only replaced the battery and then the tires, because it gets violently hot. Had to fill the r134a refrigerant and it was 50% off so i paid $95.â°â° with a Shrader Valve. The air is COLD at 110â° outside. This car is so underrated, it's so much car, room, im 6 foot 2 inches and can sit straight up with 6 inches to spare.
The basebstreo is a great sounding streo and no annoying rear camera on 2013. This car had great technology. The multi-port technology cost Fiat $100 million and increased torque by 10% and gas mileage 10% this car is an incredible value, i love her!â¤

video_title: Mein Fiat 500C ist eine putzige Glitzerkugel - Der Held am Freitagabend
comment: 25000 Euronen?? DafÃ¼r bekam man in den 90ern einen waschechten Sportwagen oder alternativ eine GroÃŸraumlimousine - mit einem ORDENTLICHEN Motor. Winziger Hubraum mit Turbo ist ein Trick: Es ist billiger bei derselben Leistung, allerdings, wie du grad meintest, muss der Motor hoch drehen. Damit verschleisst er auch schneller. Nach 4-5 Jahren kannst du das Ding wegschmeissen, bzw so lange fahren, bis er schlapp macht, denn einen Wiederverkaufwert wird er nicht haben. Der Verbrauch ist eine Katastrophe! Kein Wunder, der kleine Motor haut sehr schnell Masse rauf und runter, das erzeugt Hitze statt Drehmoment. Sorry, das ganze Konzept dieser Winzmotoren ist Verarsche. Ich kenne das von 8000â‚¬-Fahrzeugen wie Dacia, selbst bei Renault Clio (was ja Dasselbe ist). Da weiÃŸ man aber, was man kauft und was man kriegt, und selbst da verbraucht man max 6.5l/100km, da finde ich das aber OK. Aber 25000â‚¬ fÃ¼r dieses Spielzeug? Das ist absoluter Abfuck!! Abzocke mit "Lifestyle"-Werbung. Ich fahre wg. Family und tiefstem Dorf einen superkomfortablen aber untermotorisierten (nur 150PS)  SUV, der verbraucht nur 1.5l mehr als die Glitzerkugel  :-D  Alter, da hast du aber das Schlechteste aus beiden Welten erwischt. Wenn du bereit bist, diesen Preis fÃ¼r so eine Seifenkiste zu bezahlen und knackige Motoren magst, hol dir lieber einen geilen Stromer oder, falls du nicht zu Hause laden kannst, gibtÂ´s fÃ¼r diesen Preis richtige Cabrios mit besseren Leistungen. Wenn das Ding unter 10k kosten wÃ¼rde, wÃ¤re der Preis gerechtfertigt. Eine Frage: Wie einfach ist es, bei diesem Auto die Birne zu wechseln? - Oder muss man da jetzt auch 60â‚¬ in der Werkstatt bezahlen?

comment: Tout dÃ©pend si notre essayeur a ete arrÃªtÃ© totalement en embouteillage dans le calcul de sa consommation.Ne pas faire d amalgame au niveau du calcul de la conso : En effet au ralenti et voiture arretee la conso (exemple) est de 1 L au 100 Kms. Ok...donc l ordi lui considere que 1L en etant arrete (donc 1L pour faire zero km) correspond donc a une conso 100 fois supÃ©rieure a celle d une voiture qui aurait parcouru 100 Kms a 100 Km/hre et qui consommerait 10 L au 100 (je ramene a 10 L pour la facilite la comprehension). video_title: VENDETTA DI MELONI ALLA FIAT? LAPO ELKAN: SPARITO IL LOGO FIAT AL G7
comment: La Lamborghini Ã¨ un azienda che produce automobili supersportive di proprietÃ  del gruppo VAG, controllata attraverso l'Audi. La totalitÃ  della produzione della Lamborghini Ã¨ al 100% italiana, in quanto avviene nello stabilimento di Sant'Agada Bolognese (Bo). Anche la produzione di motori (il famoso V12) vengono prodotti nello stesso stabilimento cosÃ¬ come e la progettazione. Solo il V8 ed il pianale della Hurus sono di origine Audi e parte della componentistica. Ma la produzione e tutto il resto sono Made in Lamborghini. Come fai a dire che la Lamborghini Ã¨ tedesca? ll fatto che la proprietÃ  sia tedesca non ne fa un produttore di auto tedesche. Anche la Ray Ban Ã¨ di proprietÃ  della Luxottica questo non ne fa un marchio di occhiali italiano ma rimane sempre Usa. Se non fosse per il Gruppo Volkswagen la Lamborghini sarebbe sparita come costruttore di automobili, il meglio che gli poteva capitare era di finire, come marchio, sotto il controllo di un gruppo cinese che avrebbe spostato tutto in oriente. Prima di VAG, era di proprietÃ  malese e prima ancora era della Chrysler di Lee n Lacocca. Il povero Feruccio Lamborghini non avrebbe mai ceduto la Lamborghini se non fosse per colpa di una grossa commessa di trattori in sud America non andata a buon fine (per un golpe). Il punto non Ã¨ la nazionalitÃ  della proprietÃ  ma tutto il resto dove si ingegnerizza, si sviluppa, dove si fa il design ed fine dove si produce. Tutto questo conta nel definire la nazionalitÃ  di un auto, o di un costruttore di auto. E' vero restando in tema, il Gruppo FCA (ex gruppo Fiat) Ã¨ di STELLANTIS che Ã¨ un agglomerato di marchi italiani, americani e francesi che ha sede legale in Olanda, ha il controllo operativo nelle mani dei francesi. Ma siamo ancora molto forti nella produzione di componentistica e tutto sommato produciamo ancora complessivamente 700 mila autoveicoli all'anno. Ma, ci sono diversi segnali per cui le cose potrebbero addirittura cambiare, non solo per il pressing del Governo, per esempio Maserati dovrebbe ritornare sotto il controllo diretto della Ferrari. Comunque anche se diverse nostre aziende sono finite in mano a Holding straniere anche noi nel contempo anche noi controlliamo aziende straniera. Anche se il bilancio, purtroppo, pende nelle mani degli stranieri. Per quanto riguarda il settore automotive l'errore Ã¨ stato quello di concentrare tutto in unico costruttore nazionale anzichÃ© favorire lo sviluppo di altri gruppo che facendosi concorrenza avrebbero potuto migliorare che la competitiva dei costruttori italiani. L'attuale crisi del Gruppo Fiat (ora in mani a Stellantis ha origini lontane, nel momento in cui si deciso di estromettere il controllo del gruppo all'Ingegnere Ghidella per affidarle Romiti che cambio politica. AnzichÃ© investire nel settore auto si Ã¨ preferito investire in altri settori economici!

comment: L'Alfa Romeo ha il telaio Peugeot, il motore Peugeot e la fabbricano in Polonia. Cosa ci sta a dire il nome Milano. La Lamborghini stava fallendo le sue auto eranno piene di difetti e le vendite languivano. Appena sono entrati i tedeschi hanno lavorato per correggere i problemi ed hanno rilanciato con linee nuove. Se non ci fossero stati loro l'azienda sarebbe giÃ  chiusa. La Ducati andava male anche lei, anche la Ducati Ã¨ tedesca. L'amministrazione non era collegata con la fabbrica. Pensare che c'Ã¨ una scala che dagli uffici porta alle catene di montaggio. In pratica non soddisfacevano le richieste perchÃ© producevano modelli non richiesti e i modelli richiesti non li producevano, l'amministrazione funzionava cosÃ¬. L'hanno comprata gli americani che poi l'hanno mollata. Sono subentrati i  tedeschi della Volkswagen. Adesso la Ducati primeggia anche nel MotoGp davanti ai colossi giapponesi. Comunque Lamborghini e Ducati sono fatte in Italia. L'Alfa Romeo Junior (adesso si chiama cosÃ¬) in Polonia.
